document_title: Stage 4 ovarian cancer: Symptoms, treatment and prognosis
subsection_name: ung-thu-buong-trung-giai-doan-4.json_6_Palliative care for patients with stage IV ovarian cancer
subsection_content:
MSc. Dr. Luu Thao Ngoc said that in stage IV ovarian cancer, besides chemotherapy to control tumors and metastatic lesions, patients may experience late-stage disease symptoms and need treatment intervention. Treat concurrently with main treatment such as:
Intestinal obstruction: may require surgical intervention such as colostomy to control symptoms, etc.; Ascites: large peritoneal effusion causes compression and discomfort for the patient, requiring intervention to evacuate the fluid. In case of rapid fluid re-establishment, the patient may be prescribed a drainage tube.; Some other treatments: such as blood transfusion, pleural aspiration, pain relief, nutritional enhancement,...
Patients treated for stage 4 ovarian cancer need to coordinate closely with their doctors.
Besides active treatment methods, Dr. Luu Thao Ngoc advises patients and families to note some of the following:
Encourage, care, ask thoughtfully, and take care of the patient's life and spirit. Family members need to help the patient balance their emotions, avoid confusion, excessive worry, and despair about the condition.; Antiemetics or pain relievers can be used to relieve pain. You should talk to your doctor to use the correct dose and avoid abuse; Gentle, relaxing exercise such as walking, yoga, etc.; Develop a diverse menu to stimulate patients' appetite; Follow your doctor's treatment regimen, absolutely do not stop taking the medication arbitrarily or take the wrong dose as prescribed.
To find out information and schedule an appointment for examination, consultation and treatment of ovarian cancer at Tam Anh General Hospital, you can contact:
For patients who have been diagnosed with stage IV ovarian cancer, the treatment goal at this time is not to cure the disease but to provide palliative treatment, control symptoms and prolong the patient's survival time. . Relatives need to care, encourage and accompany the patient so that they can be optimistic and reassured according to the doctor's treatment regimen.
